label: 按察使
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A temporary official chosen from among trusted central (naikan) or local officials (gekan) to tour the provinces (kuni), investigate local governments, and make reports to the central authorities. The most important Azechi was the one stationed in Mutsu- and Dewa-no-kuni. [内官、外官、国、陸奥国、出羽国]
